terms.definition: A system that tracks and manages changes to documents over time, ensuring users always access the most current version while maintaining a history of revisions.
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted online and accessed through web browsers rather than installed locally.
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems.
A detailed chronological record of all changes, access, and modifications made to documents, providing accountability and compliance tracking.
A unified system where all documents are stored in a single, accessible location rather than scattered across multiple repositories or systems.
The process of improving and streamlining business processes to increase efficiency, reduce errors, and enhance collaboration between teams.
Enterprise Resource Planning - integrated software systems that manage and automate core business processes across an organization.
Customer Relationship Management - software systems designed to manage interactions and relationships with customers and prospects.
Pre-designed document formats that provide consistent structure and formatting for creating standardized documentation across an organization.
The capability of software to display, process, and manage content in multiple languages to serve diverse global audiences.
The ability for multiple users to simultaneously work on and edit the same document with changes visible instantly to all participants.
Software designed to function optimally on mobile devices like smartphones and tablets, providing full accessibility regardless of device type.
The process of combining data from different sources and systems to provide a unified view and seamless information exchange.
A central storage location where documents, files, or data are systematically organized and maintained for easy access and management.
The systematic monitoring and documentation of adherence to regulatory requirements, standards, and internal policies over time.
